Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) characterization of the applied emulsions (see Materials and Methods) revealed a silica-based honeycomb structure with ordered hierarchical porosity ( Figure 3 d,e). This structure is formed during the drying process of the emulsion through emulsion templating.
46, 47 It maintains the basic morphology of the Pickering emulsion and preserves the single cell encapsulation, as shown in Figure 3 e. This finding is important as it demonstrates the individual arrangement of the conidia on the leaves, which will lead to high efficiency of the biopesticide activity against the target insect.
